perturbation.original_text: This Agreement is entered into as of 9/28/2004 by and among The Victory Portfolios (the "Trust"), a Delaware statutory trust, on behalf of those series identified on Schedule A to this Agreement individually and not jointly (such series being individual referred to herein as the "Fund" and collectively as the "Funds"), and Hartford Life Insurance Co., Inc. ("Administrator"), a Connecticut corporation.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement is entered into as of 9/28/2004 by and among The Victory Portfolios (the "Trust"), a Delaware statutory trust, on behalf of those series identified on Schedule A to this Agreement individually and not jointly (such series being individual referred to herein as the "Portfolio" and collectively as the "Portfolios"), and Hartford Life Insurance Co., Inc. ("Administrator"), a Connecticut corporation.
perturbation.explanation: The term "Fund" is replaced with "Portfolio". Later references to the "Fund" will create confusion as to whether "Fund" and "Portfolio" are referring to the same entity, especially regarding obligations tied to one or the other.

perturbation.original_text: The Trust agrees to sell to the Administrator those shares of the Funds which the Administrator orders on behalf of any Separate Account, executing such orders on a daily basis at the net asset value next computed after receipt and acceptance by the Fund or its designee of such order. Receipt by such designee shall constitute receipt by the Fund; provided that the Fund receives notice of such order via the National Securities Clearing Corporation (the "NSCC") by 10:00 a.m. Eastern Time on the next following Business Day.
perturbation.changed_text: The Trust agrees to sell to the Administrator those shares of the Portfolios which the Administrator orders on behalf of any Separate Account, executing such orders on a daily basis at the net asset value next computed after receipt and acceptance by the Investment Vehicle or its designee of such order. Receipt by such designee shall constitute receipt by the Investment Vehicle; provided that the Portfolio receives notice of such order via the National Securities Clearing Corporation (the "NSCC") by 10:00 a.m. Eastern Time on the next following Business Day.
perturbation.explanation: Here, "Funds" is replaced with "Portfolios", but the subsequent references use both "Investment Vehicle" and "Portfolio". The term "Fund" from the original agreement is no longer used. It’s unclear if "Portfolio" and "Investment Vehicle" are the same entity and how they relate to the original "Fund". This creates ambiguity in the order execution process.

perturbation.original_text: The Trust shall provide the Administrator at no charge with copies of the Fund's proxy statements, Fund reports to shareholders, and other Fund communications to shareholders in such quantity as the Administrator shall reasonably require for distributing to Contract owners. The Trust shall pay for the cost of typesetting, printing and distributing all Fund prospectuses, statements of additional information, Fund reports to shareholders and other Fund communications to Contract owners and prospective Contract owners. The Trust shall pay for all costs for typesetting, printing and distributing proxy materials.
perturbation.changed_text: The Trust shall provide the Administrator at no charge with copies of the Portfolio's proxy statements, Investment Vehicle reports to shareholders, and other Investment Vehicle communications to shareholders in such quantity as the Administrator shall reasonably require for distributing to Contract owners. The Trust shall pay for the cost of typesetting, printing and distributing all Investment Vehicle prospectuses, statements of additional information, Portfolio reports to shareholders and other Portfolio communications to Contract owners and prospective Contract owners. The Trust shall pay for all costs for typesetting, printing and distributing proxy materials.
perturbation.explanation: The terms “Fund”, “Portfolio” and “Investment Vehicle” are used seemingly interchangeably, when they may or may not be the same thing. This makes the financial obligations of the Trust less clear as to which entities are covered.
